author: schone_wizard
content: Perhaps itâ€™s a stupid question but why do the same OPCODES have diff fees. Like what is the use of charging X on changing 0-> to anything and charging Y for anything->0

author: sky.cactus
content: It is meant to represent the relative cost on clients to execute that operation.  This isn't related to 1559 though, so should move conversation elsewhere.

author: gwintery
content: <@552133098075193354> Last update regarding EIP 1559 mentioned the need for funding for several areas. Is there any reason why the EIP 1559 is not open for CLR matching for the current gitcoin grant? I am pretty sure a lot of the community is desperate to get this going and also contribute.

author: .vbuterin
content: > The quoted paragraph talks about the network cost as if it depends on gas price

author: .vbuterin
content: It was not my intention to make it sound that way!

author: .vbuterin
content: I think my point was that the gas price should reflect network cost

author: timbeiko
content:
> <@!552133098075193354> Last update regarding EIP 1559 mentioned the need for funding for several areas. Is there any reason why the EIP 1559 is not open for CLR matching for the current gitcoin grant? I am pretty sure a lot of the community is desperate to get this going and also contribute.
Yes: we left the grant open but the amount we can receive from the CLR just isn't big enough for the areas of funding we currently have left, so we're exploring other options. There is no area of work that is currently stalled because of lack of funding, but some things could potentially be accelerated. Because the CLR funds are fixed (i.e. there's only X00K total for *all* projects) and we took a large chunk of them last time around, we felt it was better to not take any CLR funds this time.

author: gwintery
content:
> Yes: we left the grant open but the amount we can receive from the CLR just isn't big enough for the areas of funding we currently have left, so we're exploring other options. There is no area of work that is currently stalled because of lack of funding, but some things could potentially be accelerated. Because the CLR funds are fixed (i.e. there's only X00K total for *all* projects) and we took a large chunk of them last time around, we felt it was better to not take any CLR funds this time.
<@!552133098075193354> I see, thanks for the explanation. Is there a current estimate on how much funding is needed currently? I think this is also an important metric to share to the community. I as a community member is very much interested in pushing this EIP forward but lack the technical know how. Sorry if this is a bit off topic for this channel.

author: timbeiko
content: We are working on getting something to share and are in conversation with potential funding sources, but right now we're just not in a spot where it makes sense to share much more than that. We'll definitely post here and elsewhere (twitter, our implementers' calls, etc.) if we have another public grant or "milestone amount" we want to raise.
